page.title: 09BOYHOOD MEMORIES OF SHEFFORD
page.content: Eighty years have now passed away and what a difference in the ways of how we live.Ten shillings a week for the work we did and how many firms pay over a hundred pounds weekly now. Rents were from a shilling weekly and no motor cars for the working man, just a few for the better off. Roads were swept with a besom and dusty streets watered by water cart. Goods were delivered by a small pony and cart or by a boy with a basket on his arm.A large order would be delivered weekly in a four wheeled, covered van. The rivers often flooded the streets and the shops.We were carried into Shefford by men with long leggings and waterproof coats.
